Advanced_Lookup_TableObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Advanced_Lookup_TableObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Advanced_Lookup_TableObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Advanced_Lookup_Table_Data.description: Add a Reference ID when updating an existing Lookup Table Name

validation.validation: Lookup Table Name is required when creating a new Lookup Table.
The Name entered is already in use by another Lookup Table with the same ownership (Customer or Workday-owned).  Please assign a unique Name.

Column_Data.description: Enter a value between 'A-J' in contiguous Order

validation.validation: Order must be a unique contiguous value between A and J. Specify a valid Order for [Table Name].

Lookup_Report_Field_Row_Data.description: Read only - The display name of the Report Field Search Value instance. You can't update display names from this field.
Search value for Lookup Tables with Report Field Search Criteria.
Search value for Lookup Tables with Numeric Calculation Search Criteria.

validation.validation: Search Amount is not used for Lookup Tables using Report Field Search Criteria.

validation.validation: Search Text is not used for Lookup Tables using Numeric Search Criteria.

Lookup_Report_Field_Row_Data.description: Use the row as the default value (Y/N).

validation.validation: You can’t specify a Search Value for tables where Default Value is Y.

Specify a Search Value for rows where the Default value is N.
The Search Value contains an invalid value based on the type of Search Criteria specified.
A row that’s defined for [table_Name] is missing. For each effective date, specify all existing rows.
Specify only a single row with a Default value of Y for each effective date.

The field Numeric Search Value has duplicate values within [tableName]. The Search Value must be different for each row.

Payroll is not enabled for the Country specified.
